poem:
Title: "A Morning in Florida's Political Theatre"

On this Floridian stage, young Barron stands,
While the sun sets on a legacy of nomadic sands.
Tokens of power, figures in play,
A rite of passage in a usual way.
Books to be written, stories unfold,
In threads of silver, and spirals of gold.
Yet, to the analyst's knowing eye,
A deeper tale lies under the sunrise sky.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Florida is a prime example of Trump’s vise grip on state Republican parties In practical terms, Barron Trump’s truncated stint on the political stage as a Florida delegate to the Republican party’s national convention was little more than symbolic. His father Donald Trump’s third successive presidential campaign as the Republican nominee was all but certain anyway, and the names of those who will confirm it are essentially inconsequential. It did affirm to many analysts, however,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Florida is a prime example of Trump’s vise grip on state Republican parties In practical terms, Barron Trump’s truncated stint on the political stage as a Florida delegate to the Republican party’s national convention was little more than symbolic. His father Donald Trump’s third successive presidential campaign as the Republican nominee was all but certain anyway, and the names of those who will confirm it are essentially inconsequential. It did affirm to many analysts, however,
